paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR V122I variant, including penetrance data from a brother-sister pair.

patients.demographics: Brother: 61 years old, male, African-American; Sister: 65 years old, female, African-American
patients.phenotype: Brother: cardiac amyloidosis leading to heart failure; Sister: symptomatic palpitations, elevated troponin, cardiac amyloidosis

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis, heart failure, multi-organ failure.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The brother... was found to be heterozygous for the transthyretin V122I genotype.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Symptomatic palpitations, elevated troponin, cardiac MRI suggestive of cardiac amyloidosis.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic tests reveal homozygous V122I TTR genotype.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant leads to misfolding of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as the brother is affected and the sister is homozygous but has less severe symptoms.
variants.population_frequency: Approximately 4% of the African-American population carry the V122I variant.
variants.source_location: Main Text, Case Summary and Patient Descriptions
variants.additional_notes: The brother had a more severe clinical course compared to the sister despite both carrying the V122I variant.
key_quotes: The sister in question was found to be homozygous for the transthyretin (TTR) V122I mutation.
Genotyping studies reveal heterozygous V122I genotype in the brother.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR V122I variant was extracted from the main text.
